BASE_BACKEND_URL.description: The base URL of the backend service, used for constructing API endpoints. It also acts as the frontend base url since the frontend is served from the backend

PORT.description: Defines which port the application will run on

JWT_SECRET.description: Secret key used for signing and verifying JWT tokens. Should be a long, random string for security

GITHUB_CLIENT_ID.description: You can get this from your GitHub OAuth App settings. Create a GitHub OAuth App at https://github.com/settings/developers

GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET.description: This secret is used to authenticate your app with GitHub. Create a GitHub OAuth App at https://github.com/settings/developers

GITHUB_CALLBACK_URL.description: The URL GitHub will redirect to after authentication

SMEE_WEBHOOK_PROXY_CHANNEL.description: Channel ID for Smee webhook proxy. Used to route webhooks when developing locally without a public IP

SMEE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_URL.description: The target URL for webhook proxying when using Smee.io. Where Smee forwards the webhook payload

GITLAB_CLIENT_ID.description: You can get this from your GitLab application settings. Create a GitLab OAuth App at https://gitlab.com/-/profile/applications

GITLAB_CLIENT_SECRET.description: This secret is used to authenticate your app with GitLab. Create a GitLab OAuth App at https://gitlab.com/-/profile/applications

GITLAB_CALLBACK_URL.description: The URL GitLab will redirect to after authentication

BITBUCKET_CLIENT_ID.description: You can get this from your Bitbucket app settings. Create a Bitbucket OAuth Consumer at https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/app-passwords

BITBUCKET_CLIENT_SECRET.description: This secret is used to authenticate your app with Bitbucket. Create a Bitbucket OAuth Consumer at https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/app-passwords

BITBUCKET_CALLBACK_URL.description: The URL Bitbucket will redirect to after authentication

GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET.description: GitHub webhook secret for verifying webhook payloads. Ensure that webhooks come from GitHub

GITLAB_WEBHOOK_SECRET.description: GitLab webhook secret for verifying webhook payloads. Ensure that webhooks come from GitLab

BITBUCKET_WEBHOOK_SECRET.description: Bitbucket webhook secret for verifying webhook payloads. Ensure that webhooks come from Bitbucket

POSTGRES_HOST.description: The host address of the Postgres database, e.g., localhost or a remote IP

POSTGRES_PORT.description: The port on which Postgres is running, typically 5432

POSTGRES_USER.description: The username to authenticate with the Postgres database

POSTGRES_PASSWORD.description: The password for the Postgres user

POSTGRES_DATABASE.description: The name of the specific database to connect to within Postgres

GITHUB_APP_ID.description: You can find this in your GitHub App settings. Create a GitHub App at https://github.com/settings/apps

GITHUB_APP_CLIENT_ID.description: You can find this in your GitHub App settings. Create a GitHub App at https://github.com/settings/apps

GITHUB_APP_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Used to authenticate your GitHub App with GitHub. Create a GitHub App at https://github.com/settings/apps

SYNCHRONIZE_DATABASE.description: Enable or disable automatic database synchronization. If true, the database schema will be synchronized automatically. SHOULD NOT be used in production.

GROWTHBOOK_API_HOST.description: Enable or disable automatic database synchronization. If true, the database schema will be synchronized automatically. SHOULD NOT be used in production.

GROWTHBOOK_API_KEY.description: Enable or disable automatic database synchronization. If true, the database schema will be synchronized automatically. SHOULD NOT be used in production.
